revised_title: The Rowett Research Institute: Evolution and Current Research Focus
tldr: The Rowett Research Institute, established in 1914, focuses on research in animal nutrition and has expanded its facilities and staff over the years. The institute's research covers various aspects of animal nutrition, including the role of microorganisms in the digestive tract, microbial digestion factors, and the breakdown of cellulose and starch. Researchers at the institute study the effects of fermentation on the rumen, large intestine, and other parts of the digestive system in animals like sheep, horses, pigs, and birds.
